summary: The Legislative Accountability Act mandates that committee chairs in the House and Senate submit information to the Clerk of the House or Secretary of the Senate regarding amendments submitted by members of Congress and adopted during the legislative process. This includes names of members who submitted adopted amendments to reported bills and joint resolutions. It also includes information on members responsible for specific provisions in bills reported by certain committees (Appropriations, Ways and Means, Finance). This information will be included in the bill's official versions as footnotes.
